perturbation.changed_text: Throughout the entire Term, you must maintain such types of insurance, as we may require. Such insurance is in addition to any other insurance that may be required by your landlord, or otherwise. Policies that we require must be written by an insurance company reasonably satisfactory to us, and, must name us as an additional insured party.  At any time, we may adjust the types of coverage required under such insurance policies and require different or additional kinds of insurance.
perturbation.explanation: This change eliminates the legally required minimum insurance coverage for franchisees. The original text specifies commercial general liability, worker's compensation, fire, automobile liability and other critical insurances. By omitting the specific types and minimum coverage amounts, the contract now grants the franchisor the power to set unreasonably low or inadequate insurance levels, potentially violating Florida statutes requiring businesses to carry certain minimum levels of liability and worker's compensation insurance. This places the franchisee at significant legal and financial risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida Statutes regarding minimum insurance requirements for businesses, worker's compensation laws.

perturbation.original_text: By the dates specified below, an approved insurance company must issue a certificate of insurance showing compliance with the insurance requirements in this Section 6.19 [Insurance] and you must furnish us with a paid receipt showing the certificate number: (a) 30 days before beginning construction of the Premises; (b) if the Premises are constructed and presently owned or leased by you, 10 days from the Agreement Date; or (c) if the Premises are not presently owned or leased, 10 days after ownership of the Premises is conveyed to you or you sign a lease for the Premises. The certificate of insurance must include a statement by the insurer that the policy or policies may not be canceled, subject to nonrenewal, or materially altered without at least 30 days' prior written notice to us. Upon our request, you must supply us with copies of all insurance policies and proof of payment. Every year, you must send us current certificates of insurance and copies of all insurance policies.
perturbation.changed_text: By the dates specified below, you must furnish us with a certificate of insurance: (a) 30 days before beginning construction of the Premises; (b) if the Premises are constructed and presently owned or leased by you, 10 days from the Agreement Date; or (c) if the Premises are not presently owned or leased, 10 days after ownership of the Premises is conveyed to you or you sign a lease for the Premises. Upon our request, you must supply us with copies of all insurance policies and proof of payment.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes critical requirements for insurance certificates. The original clause mandates that the certificate of insurance must come from an 'approved' insurance company, include a statement regarding non-cancellation or material alteration without 30 days notice, and that you must send current certificates and copies of insurance every year. By deleting these requirements, the franchisor enables the franchisee to use insurance companies of their choosing, with potentially sub-par coverage or cancellation clauses, and eliminates the yearly verification of up-to-date policies, violating Florida law that emphasizes financial responsibility and continued compliance with business insurance laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida Insurance Code relating to notification of policy changes and the ability to ensure continuous liability coverage.

perturbation.original_text: Any reviews that we conduct under this Section 4 are only for our benefit. You acknowledge that our review and approval of a site, lease, sublease, design plans or renovation plans for a Franchised Business do not constitute a recommendation, endorsement, or guarantee of the suitability of that location or the terms of the lease, or sublease, or purchase agreement. You agree that you will take all steps necessary to determine for yourself whether a particular location and the terms of any lease, sublease, or purchase agreement for the site are beneficial and acceptable to you.
perturbation.changed_text: Any reviews that we conduct under this Section 4 are only for our benefit. You agree that you will take all steps necessary to determine for yourself whether a particular location and the terms of any lease, sublease, or purchase agreement for the site are beneficial and acceptable to you.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the acknowledgement that 'our review and approval of a site...do not constitute a recommendation, endorsement, or guarantee of the suitability of that location,' there's a potential implication that the franchisor *is* providing a form of endorsement, however weak. Florida law protects franchisees against misleading endorsements or guarantees regarding business viability. Thus, by removing the explicit denial of endorsement, the agreement creates a legal ambiguity that is unfavorable for the franchisee.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida Franchise Law prohibiting misleading representations about potential success.
